zone.line: let us drink it together and willingly &
joyfully quit this hated round of daily life
"You ter turn frome me;
yet before you deny me reflect,
Lovel Herbert, how sweet it were to
cast off the load of tears and misery under
which we now labour: and surely we
shall find light after we have passed
the dark valley. That drink will plunge
us in a sweet slumber, and when
we awaken from it what joy will be
ours to find all our sorrows and
fears past. A little patience, and all
will be over; aye, a very little patience;
for, look, there is the key of our prison;
we hold it in our own hands, and are
we more debased than slaves to cast
it to away and give ourselves up to
voluntary bondage? Even now if we had
courage we might be free. Behold,
my cheek is flushed with pleasure at
the imagination of death; all that
Woodville
